title: League = ego boosting
body:
I seriously think that the main reason people play this game is so they feel like they are better then everyone else... whether it is from scolding/correcting someone who is talking out of their ass (another example of a show of superiority or authority) or some guy who brags and brags and brags, whether he is shit or not.

There are those who feed and blame the team or just make decisions out of poor judgement and then blame the team. There are people who get fed 9/1/0 at 14 minutes wiping their attitude over everyone when their cs is 72 at best and they have no real build. 
More importantly no one cares about anyone but themselves unless they have given up or are too high to fall

Correct me if I'm wrong, but you'd probably love doing it for the sake of it anyway ;)
To be honest you don't have to say 

anything

Edit: hey look at this shit

Ign: La Baguette
Age: 23
Role: Bot (mainly Supp)
Main Champ: Thresh, Blitz, Ali
Division: Gold 1 60pts (under 100 wins atm. can climb to plat or higher any time)
Reasons why you want to join: for competitive play
Strengths: Vision control, Map awareness, objective control. **im a god**
Weakness: **none**

People like this aren't one in a million

replies.body:
It's actually not, it's very much how humans work.
If you are better than someone at something you are therefore better than them. It's wired deep into our social core, and is even pumped up by public and social media throughout your entire life.

Back in highschool I would destroy my entire school in exams, coming out with 97% as a minimal mark, and every year no one ever came close to my score in science.
By the way society works, I am better than all those other people.

But then again I have a natural affinity and love for science, as well as an insatiable hunger for knowledge that can never be satisfied, so maybe societies standards of being better than others don't apply because I'm addicted to knowledge and learning?

I play League out of a love for competition and challenge.

Back a few years ago I used to participate in tournaments for many FPS and RTS games and even a few card games. The thrill of facing someone in a taxing environment is intoxicating to say the least.

I've tried to get into the LoL scene for tournaments, but keeping a team together is difficult, especially when the people I know I can best play with are all doing University courses as am I.
So I just play for the sake of playing, waiting for those few rare matches where you can feel the desperation as neither team can get a foothold.

I have been thinking about re-entering the solo scene with fighting games though.
You most likely notice it because alot of the outspoken poeple are like that.
